document_title: Early stage nasopharyngeal cancer: Signs, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
According to doctor Tran Vuong Thao Nghi, the early stages of nasopharyngeal cancer have unclear symptoms, often easily confused with common nasopharyngitis, which is why nasopharyngeal cancer is easily overlooked. leftover. Swollen neck lymph nodes can be a sign of early-stage nasopharyngeal cancer in many patients.
Symptoms of early-stage nasopharyngeal cancer may include:
Pain when swallowing, or difficulty swallowing;; Ear pain, otitis media, tinnitus, possible hearing loss;; Sore throat or persistent cough;; Swollen lymph nodes in the neck, which may or may not be accompanied by pain or swelling;; Voice changes, especially hoarseness or unclear speech;; Prolonged nasal discharge, the fluid can be clear - colored, bloody or pus;; Sputum containing blood, pus, etc.
Swollen neck lymph nodes are a possible sign in patients with nasopharyngeal cancer
